SetOne.question: You want to have fun and feel good as much as possible.
You value your religious or family traditions and you want to live by those traditions.
You care about helping those close to you who are in need and you want what's best for them.
You care about showing respect to those in charge and you want to follow their exact instructions.
You seek out adventure and like taking risks.
You care about social order being protected and value a stable and predictable society.
You value being above average and strive to reach your life goals.
You believe everyone should be treated fairly and have equitable opportunities in life.
In groups, you prefer if you were in charge and making decisions.
You like being curious and are interested in understanding different things, people, and aspects of life.

SetTwo.question:
You really want to enjoy life.

 Having a good time is very important to you.

You think it is best to do things in traditional ways.

 It is important to you to do things the way you were taught to do them.

It is important to you to respond to the needs of others.

 You try to support those you know.

It is important to you to always behave properly.

 You want to avoid doing anything people would say is wrong.

You think it is important to do lots of different things in life.

 You always looks for new things to try.

It is important to you that things be organized and clean.

 You really do not like things to be a mess.

Being very successful is important to you.

 You like to impress other people.

You believe all the worldsâ€™ people should live in harmony.

 Promoting peace among all groups in the world is important to you.

It is important to you to be in charge and tell others what to do.

 You want people to do what you say.

Thinking up new ideas and being creative is important to you.

 You like to do things in your own original way.

Directions: Here we briefly describe statements about you. Please read each description and think about how much that statement is or is not like you.
